intro: Pauridiantha muhakiensis, commonly known as the Muhaki pauridiantha, is a rare endemic plant found exclusively in the mountainous regions of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the specific microclimate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
